 Democratic Hopefuls Play Down Gun Control

 
 "The CDC said the report suggests more study is needed, not that gun laws don't work."
 http://www.washtimes.com/national/20031002-110954-9292r.htm
 
 So the study didn't prove that gun laws are effective. The study also didn't prove that gun laws are ineffective.
montalban

Guns take lives.
 
 I like this idea about guns saving lives...
 
 You're in a restaurant. Someone chokes. They're turning blue. You leap up "Wait, I've got a .44 magunum!" and you whack them on the back with the gun-but and save their lives.
 
 Or, you're out at sea, the fishing-boat springs a leak "We're all doomed" cries the captain, but you recall you're carrying a 12-gauge. You ram it into the hole and plug the leak.
 
 Yes, I can picture where guns save lives.
Pie
If that is how you picture guns saving lives, then you are extremely stupid. Hopefully you are joking.
montalban

If that is how you picture guns saving lives, then you are extremely stupid. Hopefully you are joking.

 
 Maybe I am. Maybe I'm not. In America you need to have it sign-posted if someone is being funny... by having "Just kidding" thrown in at the end of a conversation.
 
 If you can't work it out with these things sign-posted then that's up to you.
 
 But it would be interesting if you could tell me how guns save lives (without taking lives)
outdoorsman260

One guy breaks into your house intent on killing you entire family (let's say there's 4 of you)
 
 You shoot him, therby saving 3 lives. 
 
 I love it when people talk about giving in to the criminal and not hurting people, because they just need someone to love, or something. You know dang well that if someone was trying to kill you, and you had a gun in your hand, you'd shoot him just as fast as I would.
montalban

One guy breaks into your house intent on killing you entire family (let's say there's 4 of you)
 
 You shoot him, therby saving 3 lives. 
 
 I love it when people talk about giving in to the criminal and not hurting people, because they just need someone to love, or something. You know dang well that if someone was trying to kill you, and you had a gun in your hand, you'd shoot him just as fast as I would.

 
 There's 4 of you, only 3 get saved. What happened to the other one?
 
 What happened to the robber? That makes 5. Only 3 got saved means 2 died.
 
 You could save all these lives by installing better locks.
outdoorsman260

There's 4 of you, only 3 get saved. What happened to the other one?

 
 That would be an error in math, my point still stands, if someone was trying to kill you, then you would kill him or her, given the chance.
 
 
You could save all these lives by installing better locks.

 
 Windows would still remain breakable. And, I don't care how good of a lock you install on your house, you'd still have to be able to open your door from the outside. Putting on a better lock would simply make the criminal learn how to pick the better lock.
montalban

That would be an error in math, my point still stands, if someone was trying to kill you, then you would kill him or her, given the chance.
 
 Windows would still remain breakable. And, I don't care how good of a lock you install on your house, you'd still have to be able to open your door from the outside. Putting on a better lock would simply make the criminal learn how to pick the better lock.

 
 Therefore, having a gun doesn't automatically afford protection... the burglar could be armed, better armed, or with accomplicies better armed.
